channel.title: Writing LinkedList class

item.title: Writing LinkedList class
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

Here’s my source code.

import java.util.Collection;
import java.util.Iterator;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ListIterator;
import java.util.NoSuchElementException;

public class LinkedList<E> implements List<E>{

	private int size;
	private int modCount;
	private Node<E> head = new Node<E>(null);
	private Node<E> tail = new Node<E>(null);
	
	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY
	 */
	public LinkedList(){
		size = 0;
		head = null;
	}
	
	/**
	 * 
	 * @param c Collection to add to the LinkedList
	 */
	public LinkedList(Collection<? extends E> c){
		this();
		addAll(c);
	}
	
	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 */
	public boolean add(E o) {
		Node<E> insert = new Node(o);
		if ( head == null ) {
		    head = insert;
		    tail = insert;
		} 
		else {
		    tail.next = insert;
		    insert.previous = tail;
		    tail = tail.next;
		}
		size++;
		modCount++;
		return true;
		
	}

	/**
	 * Works correctly!!!!
	 */
	public void add(int index, E element) {
	    checkIndex(index);
		Node<E> spot = head;
		Node<E> insert = new Node(element);
	    int i=0;
	    while(i != index){
	    	spot = spot.next;
	    	i++;
	    }
	    spot.previous.next = insert;
	    insert.next = spot;
	    size++;
	}

	public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends E> c) {
		for(E item: c){
			add(item);
		}
		return true;
	}

	public boolean addAll(int index, Collection<? extends E> c) {
		checkIndex(index);
		for(E item: c){
			add(index, item);
		}
		return true;
	}

	//WRONG!
	public void clear() {
		Node<E> node = head.next;
		while(node.next != null){
			Node<E> after = node.next;
			after.next = null;
			after.previous = null;
			after.data = null;
			node = after;
		}
		head.next = null;
		size = 0;
		modCount++;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 */
	public boolean contains(Object o) {
		Node<E> e = head;
		for(int i=0; i<size; i++){
			if(e.data.equals(o)){
				return true;
			}
			else{
				e = e.next;
			}
		}
		return false;
	}

	public boolean containsAll(Collection<?> c) {
		for(Object o: c){
			if(contains(o)){
				//do nothing
			}
			else{
				return false;
			}
		}
		return true;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!!!!
	 */
	public E get(int index) {
		checkIndex(index);
		Node<E> e = advanceByCount(index);
        return e.data;
        
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 */
	public int indexOf(Object o) {
		if(o != null){	
			int i = 0;
			for(Node<E> t = head; !t.data.equals(o); t = t.next){
				i++;
			}
			return i;
		}
		else{
			return -1;
		}
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 */
	public boolean isEmpty() {
		return size == 0;
	}

	public Iterator<E> iterator() {
		return (Iterator) new LLIterator(0);
	}

	public int lastIndexOf(Object o) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		return 0;
	}

	public ListIterator<E> listIterator() {
		return new LLIterator(0);
	}

	public ListIterator<E> listIterator(int index) {
		return new LLIterator(index);
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 */
	public boolean remove(Object o) {
		if(o == null){
			throw new NullPointerException();
		}
		else{
			for(Node<E> e = head.next; e != head; e = e.next){
				if(e.data.equals(o)){
					e.previous.next = e.next;
					e.next.previous = e.previous;
					size--;
					modCount++;
					return true;
				}
			}
		}
		return true;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 */
	public E remove(int index) {
		checkIndex(index);
		E give = advanceByCount(index).data;
		remove(advanceByCount(index).data);
		return give;
	}

	public boolean removeAll(Collection<?> c) {
		if(c == null){
			throw new NullPointerException();
		}
		for(Object o: c){
			remove(o);
		}
		return true;
	}

	public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c) {
		if(c == null){
			throw new NullPointerException();
		}
		for(Object o: this){
			if(!c.contains(o)){
				remove(o);
			}
		}
		return true;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 */
	public E set(int index, E element) {
		checkIndex(index);
		Node<E> e = advanceByCount(index);
		E toReturn = e.data;
		e.data = element;
		return toReturn;
	}

	public int size() {
		return size;
	}

	public List<E> subList(int fromIndex, int toIndex) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		return null;
	}

	public Object[] toArray() {
		Object[] array = new Object[size];
		int i=0;
        for(Node<E> e = head; e != head; e = e.next){
        	array[i++] = e.data;
        }
        return array;

	}

	public <T> T[] toArray(T[] a) {
		int i = 0;
		Object[] array = a;
	        for (Node<E> e = head.next; e != head; e = e.next){
	            array[i++] = e.data;
	        }
	        if (a.length > size){
	            a[size] = null;
	        }
	        return a;
	}
	
	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 */
	public String toString(){
		Node<E> top = head;
		if(head == null){
			return "List is empty";
		}
		StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
		while(top!= null){
			sb.append(top.data + " ");
			top = top.next;
		}
		return sb.toString();
	}
	
	private void checkIndex(int index){
		if(index < 0 || index > size){
			throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("" + index);
		}
	}
	
	private Node<E> advanceToObject(Object o){
		Node<E> curNode = head;
		while(curNode != null && !curNode.data.equals(o)){
			curNode = curNode.next;
		}
		return curNode;
	}
	
	private Node<E> advanceByCount(int target){
		Node<E> curNode = head;
		int i=0;
		while(curNode != null && (i++ <target)){
			curNode = curNode.next;
		}
		return curNode;
	}
	
	private static class Node<E>{
		private E data;
		private Node<E> next;
		private Node<E> previous;
		
		private Node(E data){
			this.data = data;
		}
	}
	
	private class LLIterator implements ListIterator<E>{

		private Node<E> prev = head;
		private Node<E> next;
		private int nextIndex;
		
		private LLIterator(int index){
			checkIndex(index);
			next = head;
			for(nextIndex = size; nextIndex > index; nextIndex--){
				next = next.previous;
			}
			
		}
		
		public void add(E arg0) {
			add(arg0);
			nextIndex++;
			modCount++;
		}

		public boolean hasNext() {
			return nextIndex != size;
		}

		public boolean hasPrevious() {
			return nextIndex != 0;
		}

		public E next() {
			if(nextIndex == size){
				throw new NoSuchElementException();
			}
			prev = next;
			next = next.next;
			nextIndex++;
			return prev.data;
		}

		public int nextIndex() {
			return nextIndex;
		}

		public E previous() {
			if(nextIndex == 0){
				throw new NoSuchElementException();
			}
			prev = next.previous;
			nextIndex--;
			return prev.data;
		}

		public int previousIndex() {
			return nextIndex-1;
		}

		public void remove() {
			Node<E> toRemove = prev.next;
			try{
				LinkedList.this.remove(prev);
			}
			catch(NoSuchElementException e){
				throw new IllegalStateException();
			}
			if(next == prev){
				next = toRemove;
			}
			else{
				nextIndex--;
			}
			prev = head;
			modCount++;
			
		}

		public void set(E arg0) {
			if(prev == head){
				throw new IllegalStateException();
			}
			prev.data = arg0;
			
		}
		
	}
}

Iterators I don’t think work for bi-directional (actually at all :p) also here’s my arrayList class. The Iterator isn’t done correctly though sorry BobDole professor said it was wrong 

import java.lang.reflect.Array;
import java.util.Collection;
import java.util.Iterator;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ListIterator;

public class ArrayList<E> implements List<E>{
	/**
	 * Instance Variables
	 */
	private int size;
	private E[] data;
	private static final int DEFAULT_VALUE = 10;
	private int modCount;
	
	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 * Creates a new ArrayList with the Default Value (10)
	 */
	public ArrayList(){
		this(DEFAULT_VALUE);
	}
	
	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 * Creates a new ArrayList with the value given
	 * @param size
	 */
	public ArrayList(int capacity){
		if(capacity <0){
			throw new IllegalArgumentException();
		}
		data = (E[])new Object[capacity];
		size = 0;
	}
	
	/**
	 * Creates a new ArrayList with the Collection argument being placed in the arrayList
	 * @param c Collection to be added to ArrayList
	 */
	public ArrayList(Collection<? extends E> c){
		checkCollection(c);
		int capacity = (int)(c.size()+(c.size()*.10));
		data = (E[])new Object[capacity];
		Iterator iterator = c.iterator();
		while(iterator.hasNext()){
			add((E)iterator.next());
		}
	}
	
	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY
	 * Adds the given E to the end of the List
	 * If list is filled, it allocates more memory
	 * @return true by default
	 */
	public boolean add(E o) {
		if(o == null){
			throw new NullPointerException();
		}
		if(o != null){
			checkSpace();
			data[size++] = o;
			modCount++;
		}
		return true;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!!!!
	 * Adds the given element to the given index
	 * @param index for element to be placed at, element to be placed
	 * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if index <0 or > data.length
	 */
	public void add(int index, E element) {
		checkIndex(index);
		if(element == null){
			throw new NullPointerException();
		}
		System.arraycopy(data, index, data, index + 1, size - index);
		data[index] = element;
		size++;
	}

	public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends E> c) {
		checkCollection(c);
		for(E item: c){
			add(item);
		}
		return true;
	}

	public boolean addAll(int index, Collection<? extends E> c) {
		checkIndex(index);
		checkCollection(c);
		
		Object[] d = c.toArray();
		int dSize = d.length;
		int destination = size-index;
		if(destination > 0){
			System.arraycopy(d, index, data, index+dSize, destination);
		}
		else{
			System.arraycopy(d, 0, data, index, dSize);
		}
		size += dSize;
		modCount++;
		return dSize != 0;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY
	 * Clears the date in the ArrayList
	 */
	public void clear() {
		for(int i=0; i<data.length; i++){
			data[i] = null;
		}
		size = 0;
		modCount = 0;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY
	 * Checks for the object specified in the ArrayList
	 * @return true object found
	 * 		   false object not found
	 */
	public boolean contains(Object o) {
		return indexOf(o) >= 0;
	}

	public boolean containsAll(Collection<?> c) {		
		checkCollection(c);
		
		Object[] d = c.toArray();
		for(Object e : d){
			if(contains(e)){
				//do nothing
			}
			else{
				return false;
			}
		}
		return true;
	}
	
	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY
	 * Returns the E at the given position
	 * @return E at given postion
	 */
	public E get(int index) {
		checkIndex(index);
		return data[index];
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY
	 * Returns the position of the given Object
	 * @returns position if found, -1 if it's not found
	 */
	public int indexOf(Object o) {
		int i = 0;
		for(i=0; i < size; i++){
			if(data[i] != null && data[i].equals(o)){
				return i;
			}
		}
		return -1;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY
	 * Checks to see if the ArrayList is empty
	 * @return true if ArrayList's size is 0, else returns false
	 */
	public boolean isEmpty() {
		return this.size() == 0; 
	}

	public Iterator<E> iterator() {
		return new ALIterator();
	}

	/**
	 * Returns the last position of the given Object
	 * @return index of last object instance
	 *         -1 if object is not found
	 */
	public int lastIndexOf(Object o) {
		int i = 0;
		for(i=size-1; i<=0; i--){
			if(data[i] != null && data[i].equals(o)){
				return i;
			}
		}
		return -1;
	}

	public ListIterator<E> listIterator() {
		return new ALIterator();
	}

	public ListIterator<E> listIterator(int index) {
		return new ALIterator(index);
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!
	 * Removes the given Object from the list
	 * @return true by default
	 */
	public boolean remove(Object o) {
		if(contains(o)){
			remove(indexOf(o));
			return true;
		}
		return true;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY!!!!
	 * Removes the E at the given index
	 * @return E item that was removed
	 */
	public E remove(int index) {
		checkIndex(index);
		E toRemove = (E)data[index];
		int removedPosition = size - index - 1;
		if (removedPosition > 0){
		    System.arraycopy(data, index+1, data, index, removedPosition);
		}
		data[--size] = null;
		modCount++;
		return toRemove;
	}

	public boolean removeAll(Collection<?> c) {
		checkCollection(c);
		
		Object[] d = c.toArray();
		for(Object e: d){
			if(remove(e)){
				//do nothing
			}
			else{
				return false;
			}
		}
		return true;
	}

	public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c) {
		checkCollection(c);
		for(Object item : data){
			if(!c.contains(item)){
				remove(item);
				modCount++;
			}
		}
		return true;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY
	 * Overwrites the currect element at index with the new element
	 * @return the replaced element at index
	 */
	public E set(int index, E element) {
		checkIndex(index);
		E copy = data[index];
		data[index] = element;
		modCount++;
		return copy;
	}

	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY
	 * Returns the number of elements in the ArrayList
	 * @return the size of the list
	 */
	public int size() {
		return size;
	}

	public List<E> subList(int fromIndex, int toIndex) {
		return null;
	}

	/**
	 * Creates an Object[] of the data array so it's not an instance of type E
	 * @return copy of data array as an object array
	 */
	public Object[] toArray() {
		 Object[] copy = new Object[size];
		 System.arraycopy(data, 0, copy, 0, size);
		 return copy;
	}

	public <T> T[] toArray(T[] a) {
		if(a.getClass() != data[0].getClass()){
			throw new ArrayStoreException();
		}
		if(a.length < size){
		    a = (T[]) Array.newInstance(a.getClass().getComponentType(),size);
		    System.arraycopy(data, 0, a, 0, size);
		}
		if (a.length > size){
			a[size] = null;
		}
		return a;
	}
	
	public void trimToSize(){
		modCount++;
		int oldCapacity = data.length;
		if (size < oldCapacity) {
		    Object oldData[] = data;
		    data = (E[])new Object[size];
		    System.arraycopy(oldData, 0, data, 0, size);
		}
	}
	
	/**
	 * WORKS CORRECTLY
	 * Creates the list in the form of a String
	 * @retun StringBuffer string representation of the list
	 */
	public String toString(){
		StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
		if(data != null){
			for(int i=0; i<data.length; i++){
				if(data[i] != null){
					sb.append(data[i]+ " ");
				}
			}
		}
		return sb.toString();
	}
	
	/**
	 * Checks to see if the data array needs to be increased in size
	 * increases modCount by 1!
	 */
	private void checkSpace(){
		if(size == data.length){
			E[] data2 = (E[]) new Object[data.length*2];
			System.arraycopy(data, 0, data2, 0, size);
			data = data2;
			modCount++;
		}
		else{
			//do nothing
		}
	}
	
	/**
	 * Checks for valid index
	 * @param index 
	 * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException for index < 0 || index >= data.length
	 */
	private void checkIndex(int index){
		if(index < 0 || index > data.length){
			throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("" + index);
		}
		else{
			//valid index was passed through
		}
	}
	
	private void checkCollection(Collection c){
		if(c == null){
			throw new NullPointerException();
		}
		else{
			//c contains something
		}
	}
	
	private class ALIterator<E2 extends E> implements ListIterator<E>{
		private E lastElement = null;
		private int pos = 0;
		
		public ALIterator(){
			pos = 0;
			lastElement = null;
		}
		public ALIterator(int index){
			checkIndex(index);
			pos = index;
			lastElement = null;
		}
		
		public boolean hasNext() {
			return pos < size()-1;
		}

		public E next() {
			return (lastElement = get(++pos));
		}

		public void remove() {
			ArrayList.this.remove(lastElement);
		}

		public void add(E element) {
			ArrayList.this.add(element);
			
		}

		public boolean hasPrevious() {
			return pos > size()-1;
		}

		public int nextIndex() {
			return pos+1;
		}

		public E previous() {
			return(lastElement = get(--pos));
		}

		public int previousIndex() {
			if(pos == 0){
				return -1;
			}
			else{
				return pos-1;
			}
		}

		public void set(E element) {
			set(element);
		}
	}

}

item.title: Writing LinkedList class
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Sorry for not responding to this for a while. Anyway, a bit more source would be helpful, yes, just to see how you store and manipulate the nodes, or what sun refers to as Entries.

For add, all you’d really need to do is add it to index list.size() (or header.next). Your add(E) method looks fine to me. What sun does for add(int, E) is they have a method called entry(int) which starts with the header node and basically “loops” through the referenced entries until it gets to the index called for.

Get uses the same entry(int) method to just obtain the correct element…

LinkedList is cool imo, but I really don’t like the structure I like having all referecnes objects/nodes in a tangible form instead of just referenced through a single object…I have to say its slick though

Anyway, hope that helped a bit.

item.title: Writing LinkedList class
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

hey everyone, got my ArrayList done (minus the Iterator part :p), however, now I am stuck on the LinkedList class.

I’m having trouble writing the add method and also the get(index) methods.

here’s my add methods:

public boolean add(E o) {
	Node<E> insert = new Node(o, head, head.previous); //construct does (data, Node next, Node previous)
	insert.next = head;
	insert.previous = null;
	size++;
	modCount++;
	return true;
}

public boolean add(int index, E o){
        //no idea how to do this
}

And here’s my horrible attempt at the get(int index) method:

public E get(int index) {
		checkIndex(index);
		Node<E> e = head;
        if (index < (size >> 1)) {
            for (int i = 0; i <= index; i++)
                e = e.next;
        } 
        else {
            for (int i = size; i > index; i--)
                e = e.previous;
        }
        return (E)e;
	}

BobDole, since you seem to be the only one who can help me with my sort of questions, think you can help me out? If you need any more (of what little I have) code, let me know. Thanks

Read full topic
